meanings.definition: To become excessively dirty or contaminated.
meanings.sent1: After playing in the mud, my clothes overfoul quickly.
meanings.sent2: The spilled juice overfouled the carpet.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally overfouled my shirt with paint while trying to be artistic.
meanings.sent4: The once pristine river overfouled with pollution.
meanings.sent5: The kitchen sink overfouls easily if not cleaned regularly.

meanings.definition: To make something excessively dirty or contaminated.
meanings.sent1: Please don't overfoul the bathtub with your muddy shoes.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overfoul the dishes when washing them in a hurry.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy overfouled the living room with torn paper bits.
meanings.sent4: The factory's waste management system overfouled the nearby river.
meanings.sent5: The children managed to overfoul the playground with sand in no time.

meanings.definition: Covered or saturated with filth or dirt.
meanings.sent1: The overfoul alley behind the restaurant smelled terrible.
meanings.sent2: She refused to wear the overfoul gloves for gardening.
meanings.sent3: The overfoul pond was a breeding ground for mosquitoes.
meanings.sent4: The overfoul streets of the old town were in desperate need of cleaning.
meanings.sent5: The overfoul kitchen sponge needed to be replaced immediately.
